pages.title: 1.    WATER BAPTISM
pages.content:
*b1.1    GUIDELINES*b *b*b1.    Introduction*b*b Water Baptism is one of the two ordinances instructed by the Lord and observed in the New Testament church.  It is enshrined in our commission to go and make disciples of all nations *b(Matthew 28:18-20, Mark 16:16).*b  Baptism symbolizes the death, burial, and resurrection of our Lord. It also identifies the believer with our LORD Jesus Christ. The ordinance is a public confession of our faith in Christ. *b*b2.     General Guidelines*b*b Only persons who have received Jesus Christ as Lord and Saviour qualify to be baptized *b(Acts 2:41, Acts 8:12, Acts 8:13, Acts 18:8, Acts*b *b8:36-37, Acts 16:30-33).*b Infants should not be baptised because there is no scriptural basis for such an act. When the infant Jesus was taken into the temple, He was not baptized. Rather, He was dedicated to God (Luke 2:23-24). Christ was baptised when He came of age (Luke 3:21-22; Matt. 3:13-17). The word baptism is from the Greek word, “baptizo”, which implies to immerse fully in water. Therefore, the baptism of the believer is only by immersion in water. *b*b3.      Preparation*b*b 
a.	 The Ordinance should be conducted in a spirit of reverence and
 dignity. 
b.	 The Officiating Minister should work with a team of at least two
 leaders who would assist him (her) to conduct the baptism. 
c.	 Prior to the baptism, there should be a Preparatory Class where
 baptismal candidates should be thoroughly instructed on the purpose and significance of baptism. 
d.	 The Officiating Minister shall teach and demonstrate each step of
 *b*b1.    WATER BAPTISM*b*b

the baptismal procedure at the preparatory class. 
e.	 He/she shall instruct the individuals on the mode, time, and the
 place of baptism. 
*bf.	 Appropriate Clothing:*b
 
i.	 Appropriate clothing for baptism should be worn by the
 Officiating Minister, supporting minister(s) and all candidates. ii.	 The church shall provide baptismal robes for the Officiating Minister and candidates, which shall be worn over their clothing before the commencement of baptism. iii.	The following is considered as appropriate or decent clothing: •	 Gentlemen – Track suit or T-shirt or athletic singlet over swimming shorts at knee length or below. •	 Ladies – Track suit or T shirts or long blouses that fall below the waist over shorts below the knee or stretch jeans/leggings that end at the ankle. If skirts are worn there should be stretch jeans or leggings beneath. Swim suits are inappropriate. 
g.	 Baptismal candidates should be asked to bring along towels and
 change clothing for the baptism. 
h.	 Baptism can be done in a pool, a baptistery, or any safe water body.
 
i.	 If baptism will be conducted in a baptistery or a pool, it should
 be cleaned and filled with fresh water before the exercise. 
j.	 Candidates with cuts, bruises, sores or broken skin as well as
 ladies in their monthly cycle would have special arrangement for their baptism. Candidates should be informed at the preparatory class. 
k.	 If other water bodies such as a stream, river, lake or the ocean
 are to be used, the Officiating Minister or person(s) so delegated should carefully explore and select the exact site for baptism. 
l.	 Avoid water bodies that are at high tide, polluted, or that have
 harmful creatures such as leeches, snakes, crocodiles, etc. 
m.	Persons who know how to swim should be used as defense
 walls and arrangements could be made for the services of life guards. 
n.	 The Officiating Minister should make sure that all the
 candidates are dressed in their baptismal costume before the commencement of the ceremony *b1.	 If baptism is conducted in the baptistery of the church, candidates*b will gather in the auditorium or any other facility in the church.

pages.title: 1.2   WATER BAPTISM
pages.content:
*bORDER OF SERVICE*b Opening Prayer Opening Remarks Scripture Reading Instruction on Mode of Baptism Preparation for Baptism Prayer of Dedication Commencement of the Baptism Prayer of Thanksgiving Benediction *b*b1.     Opening Prayer*b*b 
*tThe ceremony shall commence with a prayer by the Officiating Minister.*t
 *bSample Prayer*b Our Father, who art in heaven. Hallowed be your name. We thank you for the opportunity to fulfil all righteousness as we present these candidates for baptism. We ask that you take absolute control of proceedings and show yourself strong in each life, in the name of Jesus Christ, Amen. *b*b2.      Opening Remarks*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall give   brief opening remarks on the significance*t
 
*tof baptism.*t
 
*tHe/she shall say:*t
 Water Baptism is an ordinance of the church which is an outward demonstration of an inward experience. It symbolizes the death, burial, and resurrection of our LORD Jesus Christ that the believer identifies with. It is a public testimony that we have died to sin and self and live for God. *b1.2   WATER BAPTISM*b

Baptism in water literally means ‘to dip or to immerse’ wholly in water. This demonstrates the spiritual significance of being dead and buried and resurrected to a new life in Christ. *b(Colossians. 2:12).*b *b*b3.      Scripture Reading*b*b *b1*b *b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall read the following Scripture:*t
 *bRomans 6:3-7*b “. . . do you not know that as many of us as were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into His death? 4 Therefore we were buried with Him through baptism into death that just as Christ was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father even so we also should walk in newness of life. 5 For if we have been united together in the likeness of His death, certainly we also shall be in the likeness of His resurrection, 6 knowing this, that our old man was crucified with Him, that the body of sin might be done away with, that we should no longer be slaves of sin. 7 For he who has died has been freed from sin.” *b*b4.      Instruction on Mode of Baptism*b*b 
*tBefore the act of Baptism, the Officiating Minister shall give the following*t
 
*tinstructions to the candidates on the Procedure of the Baptism.*t
 During baptism: 
i.	 Candidates should be calm and co-operate fully with the
 ministers. ii.	 Candidates should not do a back flip (i.e. throw themselves backwards) when the ministers tilt their body backwards. iii.	Candidates should stand with their hands placed over their chests and bend their knees slightly. (This position will make it easier for the Officiating Minister and his/her assistants who are conducting the baptism to tilt the candidate’s body over backwards into the water). 1 Alternative: Colossians 2:12, Acts 2:38-42, Galatians 3:27, Acts 16:13-15.

*b*b5.       Preparation for Baptism*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister and the candidates shall go to designated dressing*t
 
*trooms to prepare for baptism.*t
 *b*b6.      Prayer of Dedication*b*b 
*tA prayer of dedication shall be offered for the candidates before the baptism*t
 
*texercise.*t
 *bSample Prayer*b Our Heavenly Father, we thank you for the gift of salvation and for Your unfailing love and goodness unto us.  I present Your children to You for baptism and I pray that each one of them will have a divine encounter with you, as they are buried with Christ in His death and raised together with Him to a new life of righteousness and responsibility. I sanctify the water with the blood of Jesus Christ and declare it blessed, in the name of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. Amen. *b*b7.      Commencement of the Baptism*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister and his/her assistants shall first enter the water. The*t
 
*tcandidates shall then enter individually as each person’s name is mentioned.*t
 *ba.*b *bBaptismal Pledge*b 
*tBefore each candidate is lowered into the water, the Officiating Minister shall*t
 
*tlead the candidate to make the following pledges:*t
 i. *bOfficiating Minister:*b Have you accepted Jesus Christ as your Lord and Saviour?  *bCandidate:*b I have. ii. *bOfficiating Minister:*b Do you promise to be a faithful follower of Jesus Christ and to live a godly and consistent life to the glory of His name?  *bCandidate:*b I do. i. *bOfficiating Minister:*b Do you promise, with the help of God, to devote yourself to teaching, fellowship, the breaking of bread, prayer and serving the Lord with your gifts and talents?  *bCandidate:*b I do.

*tThe Officiating Minister shall then say:*t
 [Name of Baptismal Candidate], because of your faith and commitment in Jesus Christ as your Lord and Saviour and having confessed same, I now baptize you, in the Name of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit.   
*bb.      Baptising the Candidates*b
 
*tAfter the Officiating Minister has spoken, the candidate shall be immersed fully*t
 
*tinto the water ONLY ONCE.*t
 
*tWhen the candidate is raised from the water, the Officiating Minister shall  then*t
 
*tguide the candidate to the steps leading from the baptistery or out of the water,*t
 
*twhichever the case may be.*t
 *b*b8.      Prayer of Thanksgiving*b*b 
*tAfter all the candidates have been baptized, prayer shall be offered.*t
 *bSample Prayer*b Thank You Father for what You have done in the lives of Your children. We thank You for the confirmation of Your Word and Your divine visitation upon each life. I pray that the blessings You have released during this ordinance will manifest in their lives. May they serve You with renewed commitment and love, in the Name of Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen. *b*b9.      Benediction*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall pronounce the Benediction.*t
 *bSample Benediction*b May the Lord bless and keep you. May the Lord smile upon you and be gracious unto you. May the Lord show you His favor and give you peace at all times. Amen.

pages.title: 2.   COMMUNION  SERVICE
pages.content:
*b2.1   GUIDELINES*b *b*b1.      Introduction*b*b The Ordinance of the Holy Communion, also referred to as the Lord’s Supper, was instituted by our Lord Jesus Christ before his death (Matthew 26:26-30).   It is a memorial that celebrates the death, burial and resurrection of Christ (1 Cor. 11:23-25).  The Holy Communion has a spiritual significance that impacts every area of our lives. *b*b1.     Guidelines*b*b 
a.	 Notices of the service should be made through advertisements
 and announcements during church services so that people can spiritually prepare to partake of the Communion. 
b.	 The service is a celebration of our faith. It should be a solemn
 and joyous occasion. 
c.	 Communion should be administered immediately after the
 sermon. The theme of the sermon must reflect the purpose of the service. 
d.	 A team should be constituted to prepare the tables and the
 emblems for the Communion. 
e.	 There should also be a team of servers who must be trained to
 serve professionally and excellently. They should be neatly and smartly dressed and wear gloves when serving. 
f.	  At the appropriate time, communion servers should be stationed
 at places designated for serving. 
g.	 The following items are required for the Communion service:
 
i.       Communion Emblems
 2 : •	 Communion bread (or wafer) which symbolizes the Body of Christ. *b*b2.   COMMUNION  SERVICE*b*b 2 It is recommended that pre-packaged communion cups with wafers should be used. This is a unique and handy two tab container made up of prefilled communion cups and wafer kit seals.

•	 Communion wine (non-alcoholic) which symbolizes the blood of Jesus. ii.    	 Communion Vessels: Silver, gold or bronze trays for serving the  emblems. iii. 	 Tables: Communion tables should be positioned in designated places in the auditorium and covered with clean and well ironed linen (cloth). 
*bh.     Items for Officiating Minister:*b
 
i.      A well-polished wooden table.
 ii.   Silver, gold or bronze chalice for the communion wine. iii. The chalice should be covered with its appropriate silver, gold or bronze lid or a white embroidery or silk serviette. iv.  Gold, silver or bronze plate for the communion bread/wafer. 
*bi.      Duration*b
 
*tThe duration of the service should not exceed two (2) hours.*t
 2. Communion Ceremony as an Integral Part of the Worship Service 
a.	 The Communion ceremony will be held immediately after the
 preaching of the Word of God during the Sunday Worship Service. 
b.	 The duration of the ceremony should not exceed twenty (20)
 minutes

This is Exclusively for Communion Service *bORDER OF SERVICE*b Opening Remarks Opening Prayer Worship and Songs of Praise Special Music Sermon Hymn/Chorus Administration of the Holy Communion Pronouncement of Blessings Worship Offertory Benediction *b*b1.    Opening Remarks*b*b

 The Lord Jesus, the night on which He was betrayed took bread;  and when He had given thanks, He broke it and said, “Take, eat; this is My body which is broken for you; do this in remembrance of Me” (1 Corinthians 11:23-24).

  In the same manner He also took the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in My blood. This do, as often as you drink it, in remembrance of Me”.  For as often as you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord’s death till He comes (1 Corinthians 11:25- 26).

 Take the Bread(wafer) that symbolizes the Body of Christ and say after me: As I partake of the Body of Christ, I declare the blessings of Christ over my life and all that relates to me. Amen!

*tsaying:*t
  The Body of the Lord Jesus Christ; take and eat. *bii.     The Wine*b

 Take the Cup which symbolizes the Blood of Jesus and say after me: As I partake of this cup, I walk in the authority of God. I see the victory of Christ in all areas of my life. The Lord’s perfection is my portion. I walk in wholeness of life and I stay permanently under the covering of the Most High God, in the name of Jesus Christ my Lord. Amen! 
*tThe Officiating Minister then instructs participants to partake of the communion*t
 
*twine by saying:*t
 The Blood of the Lord Jesus Christ; take and drink. *b*b8.      Pronouncement of Blessings*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall pronounce blessings upon the congregation.*t
 *bSample Blessings*b In the name of Jesus, I declare the blessings of God upon your life, home, family, marriage and household. May the Lord grant you health in your body, soul and spirit. May He satisfy you with long life and show you His salvation.

May the Lord protect and keep you and your family. The sun shall not smite you by day nor the moon by night. May He bless, establish and expand the work of your hands and make you exceedingly fruitful. May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be multiplied to you. Receive grace upon grace, favour upon favour, success upon success, and victory upon victory in the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, Amen. *b*b9.      Worship*b*b 
*tThere shall be a brief time of congregational worship. The maximum duration*t
 
*tshould be ten (10) minutes.*t
 *b*b10.     Offertory*b*b 
*tThe Music Team would lead the congregation to take the offertory.*t
 *b*b11.     Benediction*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister would pronounce the benediction to end the service.*t
 *bSample Benediction*b Now to Him who is able to keep you from stumbling, and to present you faultless before the presence of His glory with exceeding joy, to God our Father, Jesus Christ our Saviour, and Holy Spirit our Comforter be glory and majesty, dominion and power, both now and forever; The LORD bless you and keep you; The LORD make His face shine upon you, and be gracious to you; The LORD lift His countenance upon you and give you peace, Amen.

pages.title: 3.   DEDICATION OF PROPERTY

*b3.1   GUIDELINES*b *b*b1.       Introduction*b*b The practice of dedicating sacred objects (buildings, vessels, and people) is replete in the Bible. For example, the temple built by King Solomon with all its vessels (1 Ki. 8:23-66) and the wall of Jerusalem re-built by Nehemiah (Neh. 12:27-43) were dedicated to God. There were persons who were also dedicated to God such as Samuel (1 Sam. 1:20-28), Sampson and Jesus Christ (Luke 2:22-24). Dedications are done in recognition of the fact that God Almighty is the giver of life and all good things (Rom. 11:36a, 1 Cor. 4:7, Jas. 1:17). Dedication ceremonies are acts of worship to the Lord, and should be officiated with due diligence so as to honour the name of God. *b*b2.     General Guidelines*b*b 
i.	 The ceremony should be carefully planned and each person
 involved should know what is expected of him (her). ii.	 Volunteers required: Ushers, Music Team, Sound Technician, Multi-media Team. iii.	Invited guests may include community officials, the architect (if it is a building), the media, etc. iv.	 Where appropriate, special seats should be reserved for dignitaries. *b*b3.     Groundbreaking Ceremony*b*b 
i.	 These guidelines apply to the construction of a church building,
 home or any other facility. The Officiating Minister will adapt the service outline to suit the particular context. ii.	 A groundbreaking is usually a brief ceremony held on a convenient date for all persons expected to be present. In the case of the construction of a church building, it is recommended that the ceremony should be held on a Sunday after the worship *b*b3.   DEDICATION OF PROPERTY*b*b

service. This gives the members of the church the opportunity to participate fully. It also encourages congregational support and enthusiasm for the project. iii.	 The site should be cleared for the event and a platform erected (optional). iv.	 Items required for the ceremony must include the following: 
a.	 A lectern or pulpit
 
b.	 Chairs (optional)
 
c.	 Public Address System (optional)
 
d.	 Pick-axe, shovel/spade, trowel, bricks/cement blocks,
 mortar. 
e.	 Permits: Building, Environmental, Fire, Traffic Impact
 Assessment, etc. 3  
v.	 Drawings of the proposed building should be prominently
 displayed. vi.	Duration: The maximum time recommended for conducting this ceremony is thirty (30) minutes. *b*b4.      Dedication of Church Building*b*b 
i.	 Invitations to the ceremony should include people who
 contributed in diverse ways towards the construction and completion of the project, such as the architect, contractor and banker. ii.	 Dignitaries and the news media may also be invited to attend. iii.	Duration: The maximum time recommended for conducting this ceremony is forty-five (45) minutes. *b*b5.      Dedication of a House*b*b Dedication of a house is done for members of the church who own a house or building, and request for this property to be dedicated to the glory of God. Note: 
i.	 Ceremony Outline: The Ceremony Outline could be adapted for
 the dedication of any other building. ii.	 Duration: The maximum time recommended for conducting this ceremony is thirty (30) minutes. 3 Some of these Permits may not necessarily be available on the day of the event. However, there should be some evidence that the process had already began with  applications  to the appropriate or authorized statutory/corporate institutions

*b*b6.     Dedication of Health, Educational and Business Concern*b*b The outlines of these ceremonies could be adapted for the dedication of other buildings. *bDuration:*b The maximum time recommended for conducting these ceremonies is thirty (30) minutes. *b*b7.   Dedication of Personal/Business Assets (i.e. Vehicles, Machinery*b*b *band Equipment)*b Personal or business properties of individuals or business partners could also be dedicated to the glory of God upon request. On a set date, the Officiating Minister (and where necessary his/her assistants) shall meet with the property owner(s) on the premises of the property and perform the ceremony. In such cases, the property owner(s) may choose to invite some persons as witnesses to the event. *bDuration:*b The maximum time recommended for conducting this ceremony is twenty (20) minutes.

An Integral Part of Sunday Worship Service *bORDER OF SERVICE*b Opening Prayer Hymn Opening Remarks History of the Church Hymn/Special Song (Optional) Word of Exhortation (Optional) Breaking of the Ground (Sod-Cutting) Hymn Acknowledgement of Guests and Dignitaries Benediction 
*tGroundbreaking is a ceremony that marks the beginning of construction for a*t
 
*tbuilding or any other project. It is also known as sod-cutting, turning the first*t
 
*tsod or  sod-turning ceremony.*t
 *b*b1.     Opening Prayer*b*b The ceremony shall commence with an opening prayer by the Officiating Minister. If seats have been provided he/she shall request the people present to stand. *bSample Prayer*b Our Father in Heaven, we thank You for this day and for Your continued goodness and mercies toward us. The heavens are Yours, the earth and all that is in it. We thank You for inspiring us to build a house of worship to the glory of Your Name. We are deeply grateful to You for all Your diverse blessings towards us. We ask that Your presence will abide with us throughout this ceremony. This we pray in the blessed Name of Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen. *b3.2     GROUNDBREAKING CEREMONY*b

*b*b2.      Hymn*b*b 
*tThe congregation/guests shall remain standing as the designated Music Team*t
 
*tleads them to sing a Hymn such: as*t
 
*t*bNow Thank We All Our God; All Hail*b*t
 
*t*bthe Pow’r of Jesus’ Name;  O God, Our Help In Ages Past; The Church’s*b*t
 
*t*bOne Foundation; Great Is Thy Faithfulness; O Worship The King; Joyful,*b*t
 
*t*bJoyful We Adore You.*b*t
 
*tThe Officiating Minister may select a few stanzas of the hymn.*t
 *b*b3.       Opening  Remarks*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall welcome the people present and briefly state the*t
 
*timportance of the ceremony. He/she shall say:*t
 Now seek the LORD your God with all your heart and soul. Build the sanctuary of the LORD God . . . to honour the LORD’s name 4 . Unless the LORD builds the house, they labor in vain who build it . . . 5 For every house is built by someone. But he who builds all things is God. 6 Beloved in the Lord, we congregate here today for the groundbreaking ceremony for the construction of a temple 7  for the (Name of Church). We do this in recognition of the fact that God is the giver of life and of every good and perfect gift (James 1:17). As we break ground today, we take the first step in the construction of a new building for the worship of God. He has heard our prayers, led us to this site, blessed our gifts, guided our plans and He will provide the needed wisdom and resources to start and complete this building. God who has called us is faithful and He will do it. 4 I Chronicles 22:19 5 Psalm 127:1 6 Hebrews 3:4 7 Or specify any other facility

*b*b4.      History Of The Church*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall invite the Resident Pastor or a designated member*t
 
*tof the congregation to give a brief history of the church.*t
 *b*b5.      Hymn Or Special Song (Optional)*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall invite the designated Music Team or soloist to*t
 
*tminister in song.*t
 *b*b6.      Word Of Exhortation (Optional)*b*b 
*tThis should be done by the Officiating Minister. It should be brief and not exceed*t
 
*ta maximum of ten (10) minutes.*t
 
*t*bIt may be omitted.*b*t
 *b*b7.       Breaking Of The Ground (Sod-Cutting)*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall take the pick-axe and dig the earth. As he/she*t
 
*tdoes so he (she) shall say:*t
 I break this ground for the commencement of the construction of the edifice, in the Name of the Father, Son and Holy Spirit. Amen. 
*tWith the help of designated assistants, the Officiating Minister will then take*t
 
*tthe spade/shovel and remove a portion of the earth and place it nearby.*t
 
*tAfter this, he (she) will use the trowel to set a portion of the already prepared*t
 
*tmortar on the ground and place the available brick/sandcrete block on it, and*t
 
*tsay:*t
 With this brick and mortar we lay the foundation stone for the construction of the building. Amen.  
*tThe Officiating Minister shall then offer prayer as follows:*t
 Almighty and Everlasting Father, we have broken the ground and laid the foundation stone for the commencement of the construction of the building. May this building project receive Your blessing and be completed in Your honour to serve as a witness of Your power and love. From this place, the Word of God shall go forth to guide and transform lives, draw men unto salvation, be a testimony of our faith to our children and inspire and impact our community and the world.  May all who work on this building have your covering and protection in the Name of the Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.

*b*b8.      Hymn*b*b 
*tThe congregation/guests shall remain standing as the designated Music Team*t
 
*tleads them to sing a hymn such as:*t
 
*t*bTo God Be The Glory, Now Thank We*b*t
 
*t*bAll Our God, etc.*b*t
 *b*b9.      Acknowledgement of Special Guests, Dignitaries, and Ministers*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall ask the congregation to sit (if seats have been*t
 
*tprovided). He/She shall introduce special guests and other dignitariesf present.*t
 *b*b10.     Benediction*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister or special guest shall pronounce the benediction. He/*t
 
*tshall ask the congregation to stand for the benediction.*t
 *bSample Benediction*b Now may the God of peace who brought up our Lord Jesus from the dead, that great Shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting covenant, make you complete in every good work to do His will, working in you what is well pleasing in His sight, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen.

pages.title: 3.3  DEDICATION OF A CHURCH BUILDING
pages.content:
*bORDER OF CEREMONY*b Organ Prelude Opening Prayer Hymn Opening Remarks History of the Church Scripture Reading Hymn/Special Song Word of Exhortation Prayer of Dedication Hymn Benediction *b*b1.      Organ Prelude*b*b 
*tWhile the guests take their seats the organist shall play appropriate selections of*t
 
*thymns or other musical pieces relevant to the occasion.*t
 *b*b2.      Opening Prayer*b*b 
*tThe ceremony will commence with an Opening Prayer by the Officiating*t
 
*tMinister. He/she shall request the people present to stand.*t
 *bSample Prayer*b Almighty and Merciful God, we thank You whole-heartedly for granting us the opportunity to gather here as Your children to dedicate to You this Temple. We acknowledge that this is Your doing and it is marvelous in our sight. We pray for Your grace and mercies in increasing measure that we may continue to serve You in godly reverence and fulfill Your will on earth. We ask for Your presence to continually be with us in the Name of Jesus Christ our Lord and Saviour. Amen. *b3.3  DEDICATION OF A CHURCH BUILDING*b

*b*b3.       Hymn*b*b 
*tThe congregation shall remain standing as the designated Music Team leads*t
 
*tthem to sing a hymn such as:*t
 
*t*bNow Thank We All Our God; All Hail the*b*t
 
*t*bPower of Jesus’ Name; The Church’s One Foundation; Great Is Thy*b*t
 
*t*bFaithfulness; O Worship The King; Joyful, Joyful We Adore You; Rejoice,*b*t
 
*t*bThe Lord Is King.*b*t
 *b*b4.      Opening Remarks*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister will request the congregation to take their seats. He/*t
 
*tshe will give the following opening remarks:*t
 And I heard a loud voice from heaven saying, “Behold, the tabernacle of God is with men, and He will dwell with them, and they shall be His people. God Himself will be with them and be their God. People of God, it is with great joy that I welcome you to the dedication ceremony of this temple. We are assembled here in the Name of our Lord Jesus Christ who has blessed the work of our hands in the construction of this building. It is our prayer that God will bless this Temple and use it to fulfill His purpose and will in our lives and on the earth. *b*b5.     History Of The Church*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall invite a Deacon or a designated person whose*t
 
*troots go deep into the history of the Church to give a brief history of the church.*t
 
*tHe/she will also express appreciation to those directly involved with the temple*t
 
*tto be dedicated.*t
 *b*b6.      Scripture Reading*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall invite a leader or a designated person for the*t
 
*tscripture reading.*t
 Appropriate Scripture readings could be chosen from: *b1 Kings 8:27 -30*b 22 Then Solomon stood before the altar of the LORD in the presence of all the assembly of Israel, and spread out his hands toward heaven; 23 and he said: “LORD God of Israel, there is no God in heaven above or on earth below like You,

who keep Your covenant and mercy with Your servants who walk before You with all their hearts. 24 You have kept what You promised Your servant David my father; You have both spoken with Your mouth and fulfilled it with Your hand, as it is this day… 27 But will God indeed dwell on the earth? Behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain You. How much less this temple which I have built! 28 Yet regard the prayer of Your servant and his supplication, O LORD my God, and listen to the cry and the prayer which Your servant is praying before You today: 29 that Your eyes may be open toward this temple night and day, toward the place of which You said, ‘My name shall be there,’ that You may hear the prayer which Your servant makes toward this place. 30 And may You hear the supplication of Your servant and of Your people …, when they pray toward this place. Hear in heaven Your dwelling place; and when You hear, forgive. OR *bPsalm 84*b How lovely is Your tabernacle, O LORD of hosts! 2 My soul longs, yes, even faints for the courts of the LORD; my heart and my flesh cry out for the living God. 3 Even the sparrow has found a home, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young—Even Your altars, O LORD of hosts, my King and my God. 4 Blessed are those who dwell in Your house; they will still be praising You. 5 Blessed is the man whose strength is in You, whose heart is set on pilgrimage. 6 As they pass through the Valley of Baca, they make it a spring; the rain also covers it with pools. 7 They go from strength to strength; eEach one appears before God in Zion. 8 O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer; Give ear, O God of Jacob!  9 O God, behold our shield, and look upon the face of our anointed. 10 For a day in Your courts is better than a thousand. I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God than dwell in the tents of wickedness. 11 For the LORD God is a sun and shield; the LORD will give grace and glory; no good thing will He withhold from those who walk uprightly. 12 O LORD of hosts, blessed is the man who trusts in You!

OR *bPsalm 122:1-9*b I was glad when they said to me, “Let us go into the house of the LORD.” 2 Our feet have been standing within your gates, O Jerusalem! 3 Jerusalem is built as a city that is compact together, 4 where the tribes go up, the tribes of the LORD, to the Testimony of Israel, to give thanks to the name of the LORD. 5 For thrones are set there for judgment, the thrones of the house of David. 6 Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: “May they prosper who love you. 7 Peace be within your walls, prosperity within your palaces.” 8 For the sake of my brethren and companions, I will now say, “Peace be within you.” 9  Because of the house of the LORD our God I will seek your good. OR *bPsalm 24:7-10*b 7 Lift up your heads, O you gates! And be lifted up, you everlasting doors! And the King of glory shall come in. 8 Who is this King of glory? The LORD strong and mighty, The LORD mighty in battle. 9 Lift up your heads, O you gates! Lift up, you everlasting doors! And the King of glory shall come in. 10 Who is this King of glory? The LORD of hosts, He is the King of glory. *b*b7.     Hymn/Special Song*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall invite the designated Music Team or soloist to*t
 
*tminister in song or lead the congregation to sing a hymn.*t
 *b*b8.      Word Of Exhortation*b*b 
*tThis should be done by the Officiating Minister or a special guest. It should be*t
 
*tbrief and not exceed a maximum of fifteen (15) minutes.*t

*b*b9.      Presentation of The Building*b*b *bOfficiating Minister:*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall say:*t
 Beloved in the Lord, we are here in the name of our Lord and Saviour by whose grace and in whose honour we have been able to build this sanctuary. It is my privilege now, therefore, to call upon the Chairperson of the Building Committee, [Title and Name] to present the building to the congregation. *bChairman of Building Committee:*b 
*tThe Chairman of the Building Committee shall respond as follows:*t
 Ladies and gentlemen, on behalf of the Building Committee, I appreciate and thank all who, by the grace of God, played a part in the construction of this building. In particular, I would like to extend our special thanks to [to Titles and Names] 9 who gave of their time and resources to bring this project to a successful completion. May God Almighty richly reward you all for your generosity and faithfulness. And now fellow Christians, on behalf of the Building Committee of [Name of Church] I present the keys to the building to the Officiating Minister as a symbol of the entire structure as we proceed to dedicate it to the Lord. 9 He must read from an already prepared list of the names and titles of all persons who played critical roles to support the construction of the building. Where permissible, he/she could name what such people did or provided in support of the construction of the building.

*bOfficiating Minister:*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall say in response:*t
 On behalf of the congregation of [Name of Church] I receive these keys.   Beloved in the Lord, with deep appreciation for the boundless favours of God Almighty who has given us life and the resources to put up this edifice, let us all with unity of hearts dedicate it to the honour of His Holy name. *b*b10.    Prayer Of Dedication*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall ask the congregation to stand. He shall pray and*t
 
*tdedicate the building to the Lord.*t
 Sample Prayer of Dedication To the glory of the Father Almighty, who by His grace, has found us worthy to be called servants in His Kingdom, to the Son who loves us and gave his life as a ransom for many, and to the Holy Spirit who strengthens, teaches and comforts us, we ascribe all praise, honour and worship. We dedicate this building for the worship of God, for the preaching of the gospel and the observance of Christian ordinances; We dedicate this building for the conversion of sinners, the transformation of lives,  the service of God, missions and evangelism and the advancement of the Kingdom of God to the ends of the earth. We dedicate this building for the teaching and guiding of the youth, the raising of leaders and for equipping the saints; We dedicate this building for the comfort of all who mourn, for strength to those who are tempted, and healing and deliverance for the sick and afflicted;

We dedicate this edifice for the building of godly marriages, Christian homes and economic empowerment of individuals; And as members of the Body of Christ, conscious of our divine responsibilities, we dedicate ourselves to the worship and service of the Almighty God in this building through Jesus Christ our Lord and Saviour. Amen. *b*b11.     Hymn*b*b The congregation shall remain standing as the designated Music Team leads them to sing a hymn such as The Church’s One Foundation; Head Of Thy Church Triumphant; Jesus Shall Reign Where’er The Sun. *b*b12.     Benediction*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall pronounce the benediction.*t
 Sample Benediction Now to Him who is able to keep you from stumbling, And to present you faultless before the presence of His glory with exceeding joy, To God our Saviour, Who alone is wise, be glory and majesty, dominion and power, both now and forever. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

*bSample Prayer of Dedication*b Having been prospered by the  hand of the Lord and enabled by His grace and strength to complete this building to the glory of His Name, we now stand in the presence of God to dedicate this house: Almighty God, with deep gratitude to You we stand in Your presence this day and ask that You open the heavens upon this house. We humbly ask that You hallow this house and let Your blessing be upon it and upon everyone who dwells within its walls. May this house resound with worship and prayer, and may all who dwell in be strengthened and enriched with the instruction of Your Word. May this house be a home of love, companionship, mutual respect and understanding.  May your peace and joy abide within its walls. We ask for Your protection and safety by day and by night. We also ask for your angels to encamp around this household to deliver them at all times. And now, trusting in Your grace to sustain and prosper Your people we dedicate this house to Your glory, and to their blessing, in the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen. *b*b7.      Hymn*b*b

Opening Prayer*b*b The Officiating Minister shall request those present to stand (if seats have been provided) for the opening prayer.  *bSample Prayer*b Gracious and Everlasting Father, we are grateful to You for life and for this special occasion where we gather to dedicate this [Name of Facility] to Your glory and to the service of the people in this community. We ask You to be with us this day and lead us through this ceremony. We ask this in the name of Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen. *b*b2.      Opening Remarks*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister will ask the people present to sit (if seats have been*t

 We are assembled here at the invitation of the Governing Board of the [Name of Institution] to dedicate this facility to *b3.5   DEDICATION OF A HEALTH FACILITY*b

God and to the service of the people of this community. As we commit the care and healing that will take place in this building into God’s hands, it is our prayer that this facility will increase accessibility to health care in this community. *b*b3.      Welcome Address*b*b

 *b*b5.      Word Of Exhortation*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall ask the people gathered to sit (if seats have been*t

 *b*b6.      Prayer of Dedication*b*b

 *bSample Prayer of Dedication*b God of love, compassion and all comforts, whose will for all is wholeness and peace, we pray to dedicate this [Name of Facility] to Your glory. It has been built to offer diagnostic care and medication for all who will come in here with various kinds of ailments, conditions and infirmities. Health professionals do medicate but ultimately it is You who provide the healing. So, in dedicating this facility we ask that You establish Your ministry of healing and restoration in this place: grant healing and relief from pain for those who come here sick and weak; provide strength and protection for all the health professionals and allied workers who will be serving in this facility. Father,

increase them in wisdom and patience in the exercise of their skills in the discharge of their duties. We dedicate this building and its amenities, equipment and vehicles to Your might and power, asking that You protect and preserve the entire facility for posterity as well. It is our earnest expectation that this [Name of Facility] will continually provide excellent health care experience for patients to help improve the general health care delivery in this community. We pray that this health care facility will be a place of physical and spiritual healing for all who come here. We dedicate this [Name of Facility] to Your glory in the name of the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit. Amen. *b*b7.      Ribbon–Cutting*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister or any designated person shall cut the ribbon which*t
 
*tshall be at the Main Entrance of the facility. Whilst the ribbon is being cut*t
 
*tofficially, the Officiating Minister or the designated person shall say:*t
 
*tI now declare the [Name of Facility] open.*t
 *b*b8.      Tour of Facility (Optional)*b*b 
*tThe designated official of the Health Facility shall be called upon to lead the*t
 
*tOfficiating Minister and those present to tour the new facility.*t
 *b*b9.      Word of Appreciation (Optional)*b*b 
*tA designated official of the institution may be invited by the Officiating Minister*t
 
*tto say a few words of appreciation to all present.*t
 *b*b10.     Acknowledgment of Dignitaries and Special Guests*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister or a designated person shall acknowledge dignitaries*t
 
*tand special guests present.*t
 *b*b11.     Hymn*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall ask the designated Music Team to sing a*t
 
*tstanza of any of the following hymns:*t
 
*t*bTo God Be The Glory; Great Is Thy*b*t
 
*t*bFaithfulness; Now Thank We All Our God.*b*t

*b*b12.      Benediction*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall pronounce the benediction:*t
 *bSample Benediction*b Now to Him who is able to do far more abundantly than all that we ask or think, according to the power at work within us, to him be glory in the church and in Christ Jesus throughout all generations, forever and ever. Amen. May the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus. Amen.

pages.title: 1.    INTRODUCTION
pages.content: This Ministers Manual *b(Volume 4)*b outlines the ceremonies, that is; Ordinances and Dedication of Properties practiced by the International Central Gospel Church (ICGC). It presents a step-by-step approach by which pastors should conduct such ceremonies. The Manual takes into consideration the theological position and biblical principles as practiced in the ministry of the Church. This Manual serves as a practical guide and resource for the minister. It provides the standard for excellence and order in pastoral duties. The scripture enjoins us in 1 Corinthians 14: 40 that we should “Let all things be done decently and in order.” It is our prayer that this Manual will enrich the ministry of the pastor and the Church and be a blessing to all people. *b*b1.    INTRODUCTION*b*b

pages.title: 1.    WATER BAPTISM
pages.content:
*b1.1    GUIDELINES*b *b*b1.    Introduction*b*b Water Baptism is one of the two ordinances instructed by the Lord and observed in the New Testament church.  It is enshrined in our commission to go and make disciples of all nations *b(Matthew 28:18-20, Mark 16:16).*b  Baptism symbolizes the death, burial, and resurrection of our Lord. It also identifies the believer with our LORD Jesus Christ. The ordinance is a public confession of our faith in Christ. *b*b2.     General Guidelines*b*b Only persons who have received Jesus Christ as Lord and Saviour qualify to be baptized *b(Acts 2:41, Acts 8:12, Acts 8:13, Acts 18:8, Acts*b *b8:36-37, Acts 16:30-33).*b Infants should not be baptised because there is no scriptural basis for such an act. When the infant Jesus was taken into the temple, He was not baptized. Rather, He was dedicated to God (Luke 2:23-24). Christ was baptised when He came of age (Luke 3:21-22; Matt. 3:13-17). The word baptism is from the Greek word, “baptizo”, which implies to immerse fully in water. Therefore, the baptism of the believer is only by immersion in water. *b*b3.      Preparation*b*b 
a.	 The Ordinance should be conducted in a spirit of reverence and
 dignity. 
b.	 The Officiating Minister should work with a team of at least two
 leaders who would assist him (her) to conduct the baptism. 
c.	 Prior to the baptism, there should be a Preparatory Class where
 baptismal candidates should be thoroughly instructed on the purpose and significance of baptism. 
d.	 The Officiating Minister shall teach and demonstrate each step of
 *b*b1.    WATER BAPTISM*b*b

the baptismal procedure at the preparatory class. 
e.	 He/she shall instruct the individuals on the mode, time, and the
 place of baptism. 
*bf.	 Appropriate Clothing:*b
 
i.	 Appropriate clothing for baptism should be worn by the
 Officiating Minister, supporting minister(s) and all candidates. ii.	 The church shall provide baptismal robes for the Officiating Minister and candidates, which shall be worn over their clothing before the commencement of baptism. iii.	The following is considered as appropriate or decent clothing: •	 Gentlemen – Track suit or T-shirt or athletic singlet over swimming shorts at knee length or below. •	 Ladies – Track suit or T shirts or long blouses that fall below the waist over shorts below the knee or stretch jeans/leggings that end at the ankle. If skirts are worn there should be stretch jeans or leggings beneath. Swim suits are inappropriate. 
g.	 Baptismal candidates should be asked to bring along towels and
 change clothing for the baptism. 
h.	 Baptism can be done in a pool, a baptistery, or any safe water body.
 
i.	 If baptism will be conducted in a baptistery or a pool, it should
 be cleaned and filled with fresh water before the exercise. 
j.	 Candidates with cuts, bruises, sores or broken skin as well as
 ladies in their monthly cycle would have special arrangement for their baptism. Candidates should be informed at the preparatory class. 
k.	 If other water bodies such as a stream, river, lake or the ocean
 are to be used, the Officiating Minister or person(s) so delegated should carefully explore and select the exact site for baptism. 
l.	 Avoid water bodies that are at high tide, polluted, or that have
 harmful creatures such as leeches, snakes, crocodiles, etc. 
m.	Persons who know how to swim should be used as defense
 walls and arrangements could be made for the services of life guards. 
n.	 The Officiating Minister should make sure that all the
 candidates are dressed in their baptismal costume before the commencement of the ceremony *b1.	 If baptism is conducted in the baptistery of the church, candidates*b will gather in the auditorium or any other facility in the church.

pages.title: 1.2   WATER BAPTISM
pages.content:
*bORDER OF SERVICE*b Opening Prayer Opening Remarks Scripture Reading Instruction on Mode of Baptism Preparation for Baptism Prayer of Dedication Commencement of the Baptism Prayer of Thanksgiving Benediction *b*b1.     Opening Prayer*b*b 
*tThe ceremony shall commence with a prayer by the Officiating Minister.*t
 *bSample Prayer*b Our Father, who art in heaven. Hallowed be your name. We thank you for the opportunity to fulfil all righteousness as we present these candidates for baptism. We ask that you take absolute control of proceedings and show yourself strong in each life, in the name of Jesus Christ, Amen. *b*b2.      Opening Remarks*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall give   brief opening remarks on the significance*t
 
*tof baptism.*t
 
*tHe/she shall say:*t
 Water Baptism is an ordinance of the church which is an outward demonstration of an inward experience. It symbolizes the death, burial, and resurrection of our LORD Jesus Christ that the believer identifies with. It is a public testimony that we have died to sin and self and live for God. *b1.2   WATER BAPTISM*b

Baptism in water literally means ‘to dip or to immerse’ wholly in water. This demonstrates the spiritual significance of being dead and buried and resurrected to a new life in Christ. *b(Colossians. 2:12).*b *b*b3.      Scripture Reading*b*b *b1*b *b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall read the following Scripture:*t
 *bRomans 6:3-7*b “. . . do you not know that as many of us as were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into His death? 4 Therefore we were buried with Him through baptism into death that just as Christ was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father even so we also should walk in newness of life. 5 For if we have been united together in the likeness of His death, certainly we also shall be in the likeness of His resurrection, 6 knowing this, that our old man was crucified with Him, that the body of sin might be done away with, that we should no longer be slaves of sin. 7 For he who has died has been freed from sin.” *b*b4.      Instruction on Mode of Baptism*b*b 
*tBefore the act of Baptism, the Officiating Minister shall give the following*t
 
*tinstructions to the candidates on the Procedure of the Baptism.*t
 During baptism: 
i.	 Candidates should be calm and co-operate fully with the
 ministers. ii.	 Candidates should not do a back flip (i.e. throw themselves backwards) when the ministers tilt their body backwards. iii.	Candidates should stand with their hands placed over their chests and bend their knees slightly. (This position will make it easier for the Officiating Minister and his/her assistants who are conducting the baptism to tilt the candidate’s body over backwards into the water). 1 Alternative: Colossians 2:12, Acts 2:38-42, Galatians 3:27, Acts 16:13-15.

*b*b5.       Preparation for Baptism*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister and the candidates shall go to designated dressing*t
 
*trooms to prepare for baptism.*t
 *b*b6.      Prayer of Dedication*b*b 
*tA prayer of dedication shall be offered for the candidates before the baptism*t
 
*texercise.*t
 *bSample Prayer*b Our Heavenly Father, we thank you for the gift of salvation and for Your unfailing love and goodness unto us.  I present Your children to You for baptism and I pray that each one of them will have a divine encounter with you, as they are buried with Christ in His death and raised together with Him to a new life of righteousness and responsibility. I sanctify the water with the blood of Jesus Christ and declare it blessed, in the name of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. Amen. *b*b7.      Commencement of the Baptism*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister and his/her assistants shall first enter the water. The*t
 
*tcandidates shall then enter individually as each person’s name is mentioned.*t
 *ba.*b *bBaptismal Pledge*b 
*tBefore each candidate is lowered into the water, the Officiating Minister shall*t
 
*tlead the candidate to make the following pledges:*t
 i. *bOfficiating Minister:*b Have you accepted Jesus Christ as your Lord and Saviour?  *bCandidate:*b I have. ii. *bOfficiating Minister:*b Do you promise to be a faithful follower of Jesus Christ and to live a godly and consistent life to the glory of His name?  *bCandidate:*b I do. i. *bOfficiating Minister:*b Do you promise, with the help of God, to devote yourself to teaching, fellowship, the breaking of bread, prayer and serving the Lord with your gifts and talents?  *bCandidate:*b I do.

*tThe Officiating Minister shall then say:*t
 [Name of Baptismal Candidate], because of your faith and commitment in Jesus Christ as your Lord and Saviour and having confessed same, I now baptize you, in the Name of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit.   
*bb.      Baptising the Candidates*b
 
*tAfter the Officiating Minister has spoken, the candidate shall be immersed fully*t
 
*tinto the water ONLY ONCE.*t
 
*tWhen the candidate is raised from the water, the Officiating Minister shall  then*t
 
*tguide the candidate to the steps leading from the baptistery or out of the water,*t
 
*twhichever the case may be.*t
 *b*b8.      Prayer of Thanksgiving*b*b 
*tAfter all the candidates have been baptized, prayer shall be offered.*t
 *bSample Prayer*b Thank You Father for what You have done in the lives of Your children. We thank You for the confirmation of Your Word and Your divine visitation upon each life. I pray that the blessings You have released during this ordinance will manifest in their lives. May they serve You with renewed commitment and love, in the Name of Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen. *b*b9.      Benediction*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall pronounce the Benediction.*t
 *bSample Benediction*b May the Lord bless and keep you. May the Lord smile upon you and be gracious unto you. May the Lord show you His favor and give you peace at all times. Amen.

pages.title: 2.   COMMUNION  SERVICE
pages.content:
*b2.1   GUIDELINES*b *b*b1.      Introduction*b*b The Ordinance of the Holy Communion, also referred to as the Lord’s Supper, was instituted by our Lord Jesus Christ before his death (Matthew 26:26-30).   It is a memorial that celebrates the death, burial and resurrection of Christ (1 Cor. 11:23-25).  The Holy Communion has a spiritual significance that impacts every area of our lives. *b*b1.     Guidelines*b*b 
a.	 Notices of the service should be made through advertisements
 and announcements during church services so that people can spiritually prepare to partake of the Communion. 
b.	 The service is a celebration of our faith. It should be a solemn
 and joyous occasion. 
c.	 Communion should be administered immediately after the
 sermon. The theme of the sermon must reflect the purpose of the service. 
d.	 A team should be constituted to prepare the tables and the
 emblems for the Communion. 
e.	 There should also be a team of servers who must be trained to
 serve professionally and excellently. They should be neatly and smartly dressed and wear gloves when serving. 
f.	  At the appropriate time, communion servers should be stationed
 at places designated for serving. 
g.	 The following items are required for the Communion service:
 
i.       Communion Emblems
 2 : •	 Communion bread (or wafer) which symbolizes the Body of Christ. *b*b2.   COMMUNION  SERVICE*b*b 2 It is recommended that pre-packaged communion cups with wafers should be used. This is a unique and handy two tab container made up of prefilled communion cups and wafer kit seals.

•	 Communion wine (non-alcoholic) which symbolizes the blood of Jesus. ii.    	 Communion Vessels: Silver, gold or bronze trays for serving the  emblems. iii. 	 Tables: Communion tables should be positioned in designated places in the auditorium and covered with clean and well ironed linen (cloth). 
*bh.     Items for Officiating Minister:*b
 
i.      A well-polished wooden table.
 ii.   Silver, gold or bronze chalice for the communion wine. iii. The chalice should be covered with its appropriate silver, gold or bronze lid or a white embroidery or silk serviette. iv.  Gold, silver or bronze plate for the communion bread/wafer. 
*bi.      Duration*b
 
*tThe duration of the service should not exceed two (2) hours.*t
 2. Communion Ceremony as an Integral Part of the Worship Service 
a.	 The Communion ceremony will be held immediately after the
 preaching of the Word of God during the Sunday Worship Service. 
b.	 The duration of the ceremony should not exceed twenty (20)
 minutes

pages.title: 3.   DEDICATION OF PROPERTY
pages.content:
*b3.1   GUIDELINES*b *b*b1.       Introduction*b*b The practice of dedicating sacred objects (buildings, vessels, and people) is replete in the Bible. For example, the temple built by King Solomon with all its vessels (1 Ki. 8:23-66) and the wall of Jerusalem re-built by Nehemiah (Neh. 12:27-43) were dedicated to God. There were persons who were also dedicated to God such as Samuel (1 Sam. 1:20-28), Sampson and Jesus Christ (Luke 2:22-24). Dedications are done in recognition of the fact that God Almighty is the giver of life and all good things (Rom. 11:36a, 1 Cor. 4:7, Jas. 1:17). Dedication ceremonies are acts of worship to the Lord, and should be officiated with due diligence so as to honour the name of God. *b*b2.     General Guidelines*b*b 
i.	 The ceremony should be carefully planned and each person
 involved should know what is expected of him (her). ii.	 Volunteers required: Ushers, Music Team, Sound Technician, Multi-media Team. iii.	Invited guests may include community officials, the architect (if it is a building), the media, etc. iv.	 Where appropriate, special seats should be reserved for dignitaries. *b*b3.     Groundbreaking Ceremony*b*b 
i.	 These guidelines apply to the construction of a church building,
 home or any other facility. The Officiating Minister will adapt the service outline to suit the particular context. ii.	 A groundbreaking is usually a brief ceremony held on a convenient date for all persons expected to be present. In the case of the construction of a church building, it is recommended that the ceremony should be held on a Sunday after the worship *b*b3.   DEDICATION OF PROPERTY*b*b

service. This gives the members of the church the opportunity to participate fully. It also encourages congregational support and enthusiasm for the project. iii.	 The site should be cleared for the event and a platform erected (optional). iv.	 Items required for the ceremony must include the following: 
a.	 A lectern or pulpit
 
b.	 Chairs (optional)
 
c.	 Public Address System (optional)
 
d.	 Pick-axe, shovel/spade, trowel, bricks/cement blocks,
 mortar. 
e.	 Permits: Building, Environmental, Fire, Traffic Impact
 Assessment, etc. 3  
v.	 Drawings of the proposed building should be prominently
 displayed. vi.	Duration: The maximum time recommended for conducting this ceremony is thirty (30) minutes. *b*b4.      Dedication of Church Building*b*b 
i.	 Invitations to the ceremony should include people who
 contributed in diverse ways towards the construction and completion of the project, such as the architect, contractor and banker. ii.	 Dignitaries and the news media may also be invited to attend. iii.	Duration: The maximum time recommended for conducting this ceremony is forty-five (45) minutes. *b*b5.      Dedication of a House*b*b Dedication of a house is done for members of the church who own a house or building, and request for this property to be dedicated to the glory of God. Note: 
i.	 Ceremony Outline: The Ceremony Outline could be adapted for
 the dedication of any other building. ii.	 Duration: The maximum time recommended for conducting this ceremony is thirty (30) minutes. 3 Some of these Permits may not necessarily be available on the day of the event. However, there should be some evidence that the process had already began with  applications  to the appropriate or authorized statutory/corporate institutions

*b*b6.     Dedication of Health, Educational and Business Concern*b*b The outlines of these ceremonies could be adapted for the dedication of other buildings. *bDuration:*b The maximum time recommended for conducting these ceremonies is thirty (30) minutes. *b*b7.   Dedication of Personal/Business Assets (i.e. Vehicles, Machinery*b*b *band Equipment)*b Personal or business properties of individuals or business partners could also be dedicated to the glory of God upon request. On a set date, the Officiating Minister (and where necessary his/her assistants) shall meet with the property owner(s) on the premises of the property and perform the ceremony. In such cases, the property owner(s) may choose to invite some persons as witnesses to the event. *bDuration:*b The maximum time recommended for conducting this ceremony is twenty (20) minutes.

pages.title: 3.2     GROUNDBREAKING CEREMONY
pages.content:
An Integral Part of Sunday Worship Service *bORDER OF SERVICE*b Opening Prayer Hymn Opening Remarks History of the Church Hymn/Special Song (Optional) Word of Exhortation (Optional) Breaking of the Ground (Sod-Cutting) Hymn Acknowledgement of Guests and Dignitaries Benediction 
*tGroundbreaking is a ceremony that marks the beginning of construction for a*t
 
*tbuilding or any other project. It is also known as sod-cutting, turning the first*t
 
*tsod or  sod-turning ceremony.*t
 *b*b1.     Opening Prayer*b*b The ceremony shall commence with an opening prayer by the Officiating Minister. If seats have been provided he/she shall request the people present to stand. *bSample Prayer*b Our Father in Heaven, we thank You for this day and for Your continued goodness and mercies toward us. The heavens are Yours, the earth and all that is in it. We thank You for inspiring us to build a house of worship to the glory of Your Name. We are deeply grateful to You for all Your diverse blessings towards us. We ask that Your presence will abide with us throughout this ceremony. This we pray in the blessed Name of Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen. *b3.2     GROUNDBREAKING CEREMONY*b

*b*b2.      Hymn*b*b 
*tThe congregation/guests shall remain standing as the designated Music Team*t
 
*tleads them to sing a Hymn such: as*t
 
*t*bNow Thank We All Our God; All Hail*b*t
 
*t*bthe Pow’r of Jesus’ Name;  O God, Our Help In Ages Past; The Church’s*b*t
 
*t*bOne Foundation; Great Is Thy Faithfulness; O Worship The King; Joyful,*b*t
 
*t*bJoyful We Adore You.*b*t
 
*tThe Officiating Minister may select a few stanzas of the hymn.*t
 *b*b3.       Opening  Remarks*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall welcome the people present and briefly state the*t
 
*timportance of the ceremony. He/she shall say:*t
 Now seek the LORD your God with all your heart and soul. Build the sanctuary of the LORD God . . . to honour the LORD’s name 4 . Unless the LORD builds the house, they labor in vain who build it . . . 5 For every house is built by someone. But he who builds all things is God. 6 Beloved in the Lord, we congregate here today for the groundbreaking ceremony for the construction of a temple 7  for the (Name of Church). We do this in recognition of the fact that God is the giver of life and of every good and perfect gift (James 1:17). As we break ground today, we take the first step in the construction of a new building for the worship of God. He has heard our prayers, led us to this site, blessed our gifts, guided our plans and He will provide the needed wisdom and resources to start and complete this building. God who has called us is faithful and He will do it. 4 I Chronicles 22:19 5 Psalm 127:1 6 Hebrews 3:4 7 Or specify any other facility

*b*b4.      History Of The Church*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall invite the Resident Pastor or a designated member*t
 
*tof the congregation to give a brief history of the church.*t
 *b*b5.      Hymn Or Special Song (Optional)*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall invite the designated Music Team or soloist to*t
 
*tminister in song.*t
 *b*b6.      Word Of Exhortation (Optional)*b*b 
*tThis should be done by the Officiating Minister. It should be brief and not exceed*t
 
*ta maximum of ten (10) minutes.*t
 
*t*bIt may be omitted.*b*t
 *b*b7.       Breaking Of The Ground (Sod-Cutting)*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall take the pick-axe and dig the earth. As he/she*t
 
*tdoes so he (she) shall say:*t
 I break this ground for the commencement of the construction of the edifice, in the Name of the Father, Son and Holy Spirit. Amen. 
*tWith the help of designated assistants, the Officiating Minister will then take*t
 
*tthe spade/shovel and remove a portion of the earth and place it nearby.*t
 
*tAfter this, he (she) will use the trowel to set a portion of the already prepared*t
 
*tmortar on the ground and place the available brick/sandcrete block on it, and*t
 
*tsay:*t
 With this brick and mortar we lay the foundation stone for the construction of the building. Amen.  
*tThe Officiating Minister shall then offer prayer as follows:*t
 Almighty and Everlasting Father, we have broken the ground and laid the foundation stone for the commencement of the construction of the building. May this building project receive Your blessing and be completed in Your honour to serve as a witness of Your power and love. From this place, the Word of God shall go forth to guide and transform lives, draw men unto salvation, be a testimony of our faith to our children and inspire and impact our community and the world.  May all who work on this building have your covering and protection in the Name of the Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.

*b*b8.      Hymn*b*b 
*tThe congregation/guests shall remain standing as the designated Music Team*t
 
*tleads them to sing a hymn such as:*t
 
*t*bTo God Be The Glory, Now Thank We*b*t
 
*t*bAll Our God, etc.*b*t
 *b*b9.      Acknowledgement of Special Guests, Dignitaries, and Ministers*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall ask the congregation to sit (if seats have been*t
 
*tprovided). He/She shall introduce special guests and other dignitariesf present.*t
 *b*b10.     Benediction*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister or special guest shall pronounce the benediction. He/*t
 
*tshall ask the congregation to stand for the benediction.*t
 *bSample Benediction*b Now may the God of peace who brought up our Lord Jesus from the dead, that great Shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting covenant, make you complete in every good work to do His will, working in you what is well pleasing in His sight, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen.

*bORDER OF CEREMONY*b Organ Prelude Opening Prayer Hymn Opening Remarks History of the Church Scripture Reading Hymn/Special Song Word of Exhortation Prayer of Dedication Hymn Benediction *b*b1.      Organ Prelude*b*b

We acknowledge that this is Your doing and it is marvelous in our sight. We pray for Your grace and mercies in increasing measure that we may continue to serve You in godly reverence and fulfill Your will on earth. We ask for Your presence to continually be with us in the Name of Jesus Christ our Lord and Saviour. Amen. *b3.3  DEDICATION OF A CHURCH BUILDING*b

*tthem to sing a hymn such as:*t
 
*t*bNow Thank We All Our God; All Hail the*b*t
 
*t*bPower of Jesus’ Name; The Church’s One Foundation; Great Is Thy*b*t
 
*t*bFaithfulness; O Worship The King; Joyful, Joyful We Adore You; Rejoice,*b*t
 
*t*bThe Lord Is King.*b*t
 *b*b4.      Opening Remarks*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister will request the congregation to take their seats. He/*t
 
*tshe will give the following opening remarks:*t
 And I heard a loud voice from heaven saying, “Behold, the tabernacle of God is with men, and He will dwell with them, and they shall be His people. God Himself will be with them and be their God. People of God, it is with great joy that I welcome you to the dedication ceremony of this temple. We are assembled here in the Name of our Lord Jesus Christ who has blessed the work of our hands in the construction of this building. It is our prayer that God will bless this Temple and use it to fulfill His purpose and will in our lives and on the earth. *b*b5.     History Of The Church*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall invite a Deacon or a designated person whose*t
 
*troots go deep into the history of the Church to give a brief history of the church.*t
 
*tHe/she will also express appreciation to those directly involved with the temple*t
 
*tto be dedicated.*t
 *b*b6.      Scripture Reading*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall invite a leader or a designated person for the*t
 
*tscripture reading.*t
 Appropriate Scripture readings could be chosen from: *b1 Kings 8:27 -30*b 22 Then Solomon stood before the altar of the LORD in the presence of all the assembly of Israel, and spread out his hands toward heaven; 23 and he said: “LORD God of Israel, there is no God in heaven above or on earth below like You,

who keep Your covenant and mercy with Your servants who walk before You with all their hearts. 24 You have kept what You promised Your servant David my father; You have both spoken with Your mouth and fulfilled it with Your hand, as it is this day… 27 But will God indeed dwell on the earth? Behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain You. How much less this temple which I have built! 28 Yet regard the prayer of Your servant and his supplication, O LORD my God, and listen to the cry and the prayer which Your servant is praying before You today: 29 that Your eyes may be open toward this temple night and day, toward the place of which You said, ‘My name shall be there,’ that You may hear the prayer which Your servant makes toward this place. 30 And may You hear the supplication of Your servant and of Your people …, when they pray toward this place. Hear in heaven Your dwelling place; and when You hear, forgive. OR *bPsalm 84*b How lovely is Your tabernacle, O LORD of hosts! 2 My soul longs, yes, even faints for the courts of the LORD; my heart and my flesh cry out for the living God. 3 Even the sparrow has found a home, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young—Even Your altars, O LORD of hosts, my King and my God. 4 Blessed are those who dwell in Your house; they will still be praising You. 5 Blessed is the man whose strength is in You, whose heart is set on pilgrimage. 6 As they pass through the Valley of Baca, they make it a spring; the rain also covers it with pools. 7 They go from strength to strength; eEach one appears before God in Zion. 8 O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer; Give ear, O God of Jacob!  9 O God, behold our shield, and look upon the face of our anointed. 10 For a day in Your courts is better than a thousand. I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God than dwell in the tents of wickedness. 11 For the LORD God is a sun and shield; the LORD will give grace and glory; no good thing will He withhold from those who walk uprightly. 12 O LORD of hosts, blessed is the man who trusts in You!

OR *bPsalm 122:1-9*b I was glad when they said to me, “Let us go into the house of the LORD.” 2 Our feet have been standing within your gates, O Jerusalem! 3 Jerusalem is built as a city that is compact together, 4 where the tribes go up, the tribes of the LORD, to the Testimony of Israel, to give thanks to the name of the LORD. 5 For thrones are set there for judgment, the thrones of the house of David. 6 Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: “May they prosper who love you. 7 Peace be within your walls, prosperity within your palaces.” 8 For the sake of my brethren and companions, I will now say, “Peace be within you.” 9  Because of the house of the LORD our God I will seek your good. OR *bPsalm 24:7-10*b 7 Lift up your heads, O you gates! And be lifted up, you everlasting doors! And the King of glory shall come in. 8 Who is this King of glory? The LORD strong and mighty, The LORD mighty in battle. 9 Lift up your heads, O you gates! Lift up, you everlasting doors! And the King of glory shall come in. 10 Who is this King of glory? The LORD of hosts, He is the King of glory. *b*b7.     Hymn/Special Song*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall invite the designated Music Team or soloist to*t
 
*tminister in song or lead the congregation to sing a hymn.*t
 *b*b8.      Word Of Exhortation*b*b 
*tThis should be done by the Officiating Minister or a special guest. It should be*t
 
*tbrief and not exceed a maximum of fifteen (15) minutes.*t

*b*b9.      Presentation of The Building*b*b *bOfficiating Minister:*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall say:*t
 Beloved in the Lord, we are here in the name of our Lord and Saviour by whose grace and in whose honour we have been able to build this sanctuary. It is my privilege now, therefore, to call upon the Chairperson of the Building Committee, [Title and Name] to present the building to the congregation. *bChairman of Building Committee:*b 
*tThe Chairman of the Building Committee shall respond as follows:*t
 Ladies and gentlemen, on behalf of the Building Committee, I appreciate and thank all who, by the grace of God, played a part in the construction of this building. In particular, I would like to extend our special thanks to [to Titles and Names] 9 who gave of their time and resources to bring this project to a successful completion. May God Almighty richly reward you all for your generosity and faithfulness. And now fellow Christians, on behalf of the Building Committee of [Name of Church] I present the keys to the building to the Officiating Minister as a symbol of the entire structure as we proceed to dedicate it to the Lord. 9 He must read from an already prepared list of the names and titles of all persons who played critical roles to support the construction of the building. Where permissible, he/she could name what such people did or provided in support of the construction of the building.

*bOfficiating Minister:*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall say in response:*t
 On behalf of the congregation of [Name of Church] I receive these keys.   Beloved in the Lord, with deep appreciation for the boundless favours of God Almighty who has given us life and the resources to put up this edifice, let us all with unity of hearts dedicate it to the honour of His Holy name. *b*b10.    Prayer Of Dedication*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall ask the congregation to stand. He shall pray and*t
 
*tdedicate the building to the Lord.*t
 Sample Prayer of Dedication To the glory of the Father Almighty, who by His grace, has found us worthy to be called servants in His Kingdom, to the Son who loves us and gave his life as a ransom for many, and to the Holy Spirit who strengthens, teaches and comforts us, we ascribe all praise, honour and worship. We dedicate this building for the worship of God, for the preaching of the gospel and the observance of Christian ordinances; We dedicate this building for the conversion of sinners, the transformation of lives,  the service of God, missions and evangelism and the advancement of the Kingdom of God to the ends of the earth. We dedicate this building for the teaching and guiding of the youth, the raising of leaders and for equipping the saints; We dedicate this building for the comfort of all who mourn, for strength to those who are tempted, and healing and deliverance for the sick and afflicted;

We dedicate this edifice for the building of godly marriages, Christian homes and economic empowerment of individuals; And as members of the Body of Christ, conscious of our divine responsibilities, we dedicate ourselves to the worship and service of the Almighty God in this building through Jesus Christ our Lord and Saviour. Amen. *b*b11.     Hymn*b*b The congregation shall remain standing as the designated Music Team leads them to sing a hymn such as The Church’s One Foundation; Head Of Thy Church Triumphant; Jesus Shall Reign Where’er The Sun. *b*b12.     Benediction*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall pronounce the benediction.*t
 Sample Benediction Now to Him who is able to keep you from stumbling, And to present you faultless before the presence of His glory with exceeding joy, To God our Saviour, Who alone is wise, be glory and majesty, dominion and power, both now and forever. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
