 *bSample Benediction*b The LORD bless you and keep you; the LORD make His face shine upon you, And be gracious to you; The LORD lift up His countenance upon you, And give you peace.  And let the beauty of the LORD our God be upon you, and establish the work of your hands. Amen.

pages.title: 3.8   DEDICATION OF VEHICLES,
pages.content:
*bORDER OF SERVICE*b Opening Prayer Hymn Opening Remarks Scripture Reading Word of Exhortation Prayer of Dedication Hymn Benediction *b*b1.     Opening Prayer*b*b 
*tThe ceremony will commence with an Opening Prayer by the Officiating*t
 
*tMinister.*t
 *bSample Prayer*b Our Father in Heaven, we are grateful to You for life and for Your grace and mercies that are new every morning.  Today our hearts are filled with gratitude and joy as we seek Your blessing and dedicate this [Name of Asset] to You. We pray that You will be with us as we honour Your name in this place. In the Name of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ we have prayed. Amen. *b*b2.      Hymn*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall ask the designated song leader to lead in singing*t
 
*ta hymn such as:*t
 
*t*bNow Thank We All Our God; Rejoice, the Lord Is King;*b*t
 
*t*bImmortal, Invisible God Only Wise, etc.*b*t
 *b*b3.     Opening Remarks*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall give the following Opening Remarks:*t
 *b3.8   DEDICATION OF VEHICLES,*b *bMACHINERY AND EQUIPMENT*b

Ladies and gentlemen, we are here today in the presence of God and these witnesses to dedicate [Name of Asset] to the glory and praise of our Lord. We do this in the belief that God is the source of all our assets. The scriptures declare that “every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, and comes down from the Father of lights, with whom there is  no variation or shadow of turning” (James 1:17) 16 . As we honour God and appreciate all that He bestows upon us, He enriches our lives the more with His blessings. *b*b4.      Word of Exhortation*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall give the Word of Exhortation. It should be brief,*t
 
*tnot exceeding five (5) minutes. It may be omitted altogether).*t
 *b*b5.       Prayer Of Dedication*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall pray and dedicate the asset(s).*t
 *bSample Prayer of Dedication*b Our heavenly Father, giver of every good and perfect gift, we are before You this day filled with gratitude for blessing [Name of Owner] with [Name of Asset]. In the sanctifying power of Your Holy Name we dedicate this [Name of Asset] for the purpose for which the asset was acquired . May Your blessing be upon this asset and upon everyone who drives or operates it. We dedicate this [Name of Asset] to the sustaining grace of Your power for efficiency in operation and performance; that this asset shall be sustained beyond the warranty of the manufacturer. We dedicate this [Name of Asset] to You for productivity and profitability. We dedicate this vehicle/ machinery/ equipment to Your protective care; that the operators shall be protected and preserved from harm/injury day and night; that there shall be no incidents or accidents that would blemish its function and value. 16 Other scriptures related to the dedication of assets: 2 Chronicles7:9, Nehemiah 12:27, I Kings 8, Psalms 90:17

We dedicate this [Name of Asset] to You for continual peace, joy and fulfillment of the owner and, by extension, all who shall be privileged to enjoy the productive services of the asset. Trusting that whatever we entrust into Your mighty Hand shall endure its  purposeful longevity, we dedicate this [Name of Asset] to Your glory for the blessing of [Name of Owner] and all who shall be privileged to benefit from its/ their productive services. We dedicate this asset in the mighty Name of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit. Amen. *b*b6.      Hymn*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall ask the designated song leader to lead the people*t
 
*tin singing a stanza of any of the following hymns: Now Thank We All Our God;*t
 
*tPraise Him, Praise Him; Jesus Our Blessed Redeemer; Joyful, Joyful We Adore*t
 
*tYou*t
 *b*b7.      Benediction*b*b 
*tThe Officiating Minister shall pronounce the benediction:*t
 *bSample Benediction*b Grace and peace be multiplied to you in the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord. May the favour of the Lord our God rest upon us. May He establish the work of your hands. Amen.

pages.title: 4.    BENEDICTION SCRIPTURES
pages.content: *b*b4.    BENEDICTION SCRIPTURES*b*b 1. “The LORD bless you and keep you; The LORD make His face shine upon you, and be gracious to you; The LORD lift up His countenance upon you, And give you peace.” *b(Numbers 6:24-26)*b 2. Now may the God of peace who brought up our Lord Jesus from the dead, that great Shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the everlasting covenant, make you complete in every good work to do His will, working in you what is well pleasing in His sight, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen.  *b(Hebrews 13:20-21)*b 3. Now may the God of patience and comfort grant you to be like- minded toward one another, according to Christ Jesus, that you may, with one mind and one mouth, glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. *b(Romans 15:5-6)*b 4. Now may the God of peace  Himself sanctify you completely, and may your whole spirit and soul and body be kept blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. He who calls you is faithful;  He will surely do it. *b(1 Thess. 5:23-24)*b 5. Now may our Lord Jesus Christ Himself, and God our Father, who loved us and gave us eternal comfort and good hope through grace, comfort your hearts and establish you in every good work and word. *b(2 Thess. 2:16-17 )*b 6. May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, so that by the power of the Holy Spirit you may abound in hope. *b(Romans 15:13)*b 7. May God give you heaven’s dew and earth’s richness— an abundance of grain and new wine. *b(Genesis 27:28)*b

Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.*b Amen. *b(Galatians 6:18)*b *b17.	 Grace, mercy, and peace will be with you from God the Father and*b from the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love. *b(2 John 3)*b *b18.	 Peace be to the brothers, and love with faith, from God the Father*b and the Lord Jesus Christ. Grace be with all who love our Lord Jesus Christ with love incorruptible. *b(Ephesians 6:23-24)*b *b19.	 Now to him who is able to do far more abundantly than all that we*b ask or think, according to the power at work within us, to him be glory in the church and in Christ Jesus throughout all generations, forever and ever. Amen. *b(Ephesians 3:20-21)*b

*b20.	 Now to Him who is able to keep you from stumbling, And to present*b you faultless Before the presence of His glory with exceeding joy, To God our Savior, Who alone is wise, Be glory and majesty, Dominion and power, both now and forever. Amen. *b(Jude 24-25)*b *b21. Amen. *b(Jude 24-25)*b *b22.	 Now to the King eternal, immortal, invisible, to God who alone is*b wise, be honor and glory forever and ever. Amen. *b(1 Timothy 1:17)*b *b23. Amen. *b(Revelation 1:5b-6)*b *b24.	 Blessing and glory and wisdom and thanksgiving and honor and*b power and might be to our God forever and ever! Amen. *b(Revelation*b *b7:12)*b *b25.	 And God is able to bless you abundantly, so that in all things at*b all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good work. *b(2 Corinthians 9:8)*b *b26. To him be honor and eternal dominion. Amen. *b(1 Timothy 6:15b-16)*b *b28.	 Worthy is the Lamb who was slain, to receive power and wealth*b and wisdom and might and honor and glory and blessing! …To him who sits on the throne and to the Lamb be blessing and honor and glory and might forever and ever! *b(Revelation 5:12, 13)*b
